item.title: CyberArk snaps up Zilla Security for up to $175M
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Information security company CyberArk has acquired identity access and governance platform Zilla Security in a deal worth up to $175 million. Founded in 1999, Boston-based CyberArk specializes in access management, including privileged access security which helps organizations protect sensitive data and critical infrastructure from external (and internal) threats. CyberArk went public on the Nasdaq in […]

item.title: Avride launches sidewalk delivery bots on Uber Eats in Jersey City
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Uber Eats customers in Jersey City can now have their orders delivered by one of Avride’s autonomous sidewalk delivery robots. The launch, which kicked off this week in New Jersey, is Uber’s latest foray into autonomous vehicles and represents an expanding relationship with Avride. The ride-hail and delivery giant deploys AVs on its app in […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Sophos lays off 6% of workforce following Secureworks acquisition
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
The layoffs come soon after Sophos completed its $859 million acquisition of Secureworks.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apple’s app tracking privacy framework could fall foul of German antitrust rules
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Germany’s antitrust watchdog has been investigating Apple’s app privacy framework since 2022. On Thursday, releasing preliminary findings from this probe, the Bundeskartellamt (FCO) said it suspects the iPhone maker may not be treating third-party app developers as equally as the law requires. The antitrust watchdog said it believes Apple’s behavior could amount to self-preferencing. Apple […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Apptronik, which makes humanoid robots, raises $350M as category heats up
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apptronik, a University of Texas spin-out that was quietly building humanoid robots before it became quite so fashionable, on Thursday announced a $350 million Series A round of financing. B Capital and Capital Factory co-led the round, which also featured participation from Google, whose DeepMind division is partnering with Apptronik to deliver embodied AI for […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mercedes-AMG Petronas F1 team steers toward nature-based carbon credits
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The Mercedes-AMG Petronas team is buying 5,500 metric tons worth of carbon credits from Chestnut Carbon.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Telegram releases improved sticker search and video consumption features
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Chat app Telegram, which became profitable last year, released new updates to its apps, including improved sticker search, choosing video covers, and the ability to copy videos at the current time. The company first released its AI-powered sticker search in December, which allowed you to look for stickers using natural language. However, it was limited […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Barcelona-based spyware startup Variston shuts down, per filing
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Variston, a Barcelona-based spyware vendor, has reportedly shut down. Intelligence Online, a trade publication that covers the surveillance and intelligence industry, reports that a legal notice published in Barcelona’s registry on February 10 confirmed that Variston has been liquidated. TechCrunch has also seen the legal notice saying Variston has shuttered. This comes almost exactly a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Docker’s new CEO is former Oracle Cloud exec Don Johnson
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Developer tooling and containerization company Docker has a new CEO: Former Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) executive vice president Don Johnson (pictured above) landed in the hotseat starting Wednesday. Incumbent Scott Johnston will leave the company with immediate effect. During his eight-year spell at Oracle, Johnson was instrumental in transitioning the company from its legacy on-premise […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: China’s Salt Typhoon hackers continue to breach telecom firms despite US sanctions
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Threat intelligence firm Recorded Future said it had observed Salt Typhoon breaching 5 telcos between December 2024 and January 2025.

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk will withdraw bid for OpenAI’s nonprofit if its board agrees to terms
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
In a court filing on Wednesday, a lawyer for Elon Musk said the billionaire will withdraw his $97.4 billion bid for OpenAI’s nonprofit if the ChatGPT maker’s board of directors “preserve the charity’s mission” and halt the company’s conversion to a for-profit. The filing, submitted to the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Coinbase eyes re-entry to India
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Coinbase is working on its re-entry to India more than a year after it officially ceased operations in the world’s most populous nation. The American crypto exchange is engaging with various Indian authorities, including the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU), an Indian government agency that scrutinizes financial transactions, according to two sources familiar with the matter […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Getaround abruptly shuts down US car-sharing operations
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Getaround, a company that helps vehicle owners rent out their cars, trucks and SUVs to other peers, is shutting down its U.S. operations one year after cutting 30% of its North American workforce as part of a restructuring. Its HyreCar business, which it acquired in 2023 for $9.45 million, is also closing. The company said […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: US pharma giant Merck backs healthcare marketplace HD in Southeast Asia
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
Big Tech and pharmaceutical companies are accelerating the implementation of artificial intelligence in the healthcare industry. Just last month, AWS and General Catalyst announced their partnership to speed up the development and deployment of healthcare AI tools. GE Healthcare teamed up with AWS to build generative AI for medical use in 2024.   Now, a […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Ulu Ventures sticks to its diversity strategy, raises $208M
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
While large corporations like Google and Meta are curbing their DEI programs, Ulu Ventures, which just raised a fourth fund at $208 million, doesn’t plan to change its strategy of investing in diverse founders, the firm told The Wall Street Journal. Co-founded by Miriam Rivera, a Latina and former vice president and deputy general counsel […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X will pay Trump $10M to settle lawsuit over 2021 ban
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Elon Musk’s X has agreed to pay President Donald Trump $10 million to settle a lawsuit from the days when the company was still called Twitter and owned by Jack Dorsey, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing unnamed sources. The lawsuit took issue with Twitter’s decision to ban Trump after January 6, when Trump’s supporters […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Founded by DeepMind alumnus, Latent Labs launches with $50M to make biology programmable
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
A new startup founded by a former Google DeepMind scientist is exiting stealth with $50 million in funding. Latent Labs is building AI foundation models to “make biology programmable,” and it plans to partner with biotech and pharmaceutical companies to generate and optimize proteins. It’s impossible to understand what DeepMind and its ilk are doing […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Reddit hints at expanded AI-powered search
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Reddit CEO Steve Huffman said the online forum site plans to launch an upgraded search experience in 2025 designed to help users navigate the social network and be able to answer “subjective hard, [and] interesting questions.” The company plans to achieve this by integrating Reddit Answers — a feature that allows visitors to ask questions […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: VC industry reacts to Trump nominating a16z’s Brian Quintenz for regulatory role
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description:
Brian Quintenz, who leads policy for Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto team, announced on Wednesday that he’s being tapped to head the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), according to his X post. And many in the VC industry appear to be thrilled about it. The CFTC regulates the trading of commodity futures, options, and swaps, otherwise known […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: OpenAI pledges that its models won’t censor viewpoints
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
OpenAI is making clear that its AI models won’t shy away from sensitive topics, and will refrain from making assertions that might “shut out some viewpoints.” In an updated version of its Model Spec, a collection of high-level rules that indirectly govern OpenAI’s models, OpenAI says that its models “must never attempt to steer the user in […]
